Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So, I'm happy to be here. It's very nice to see all of you. You're all looking well.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Today's a 'women in the workplace' thing. Jan's coming in from Corporate to talk to all the women about... um... I don't really know what. But Michael's not allowed in. She said that about five times.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Women today, though we have the same options as men, we often face a very different set of obstacles in getting there. So...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [knocks] Hey, what's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael... I thought we agreed you wouldn't be here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah... I... You know what... I... I... I just thought about it. I just have a few things I want to say.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hold... Just hear me out. What is more important than Quality? E-Quality. Now studies show that today's woman, the Ally McBeal woman, as I call her, is at a crossroads...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, just uh... you have come a long way, baby. But I just... just want to keep it within reason.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They did this up in Albany...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You are not allowed in this session.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And they ended up turning the break room into a lactation room which is disgusting so...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Now you're really not allowed in this session.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I'm their boss, so I feel like...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm your boss.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [stands up] Anybody want any coffee or...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: We're fine, Michael. We just need you to leave, please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Women in the workplace... yeah, translation "I have been banned from my own conference room so that Jan can talk in secret to all the girls." Oh! Sorry. 'Women of the workplace.' About what? I don't know. Clothes. Me. Eeegkh!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Ladies, I am so, so sorry. Can we start again? We were on such a roll. I... I... really apologize.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yes, Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael's still at the door.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [in the background] So one obstacle is how assertiveness is perceived differently in men and women. Men who are assertive will be admired. They're called... anyone?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a terrible idea.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What is?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Them in there all together. If they stay in there too long they're going to get on the same cycle. Wreak havoc on our plumbing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everyone. Guys. Circle up, please. Come on over. Bring your chairs. Toby, come on over. You're a guy... too... sort of. Let's do this!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in the background] Well, first of all, I, uh, just want to warm up a little bit. Let's just clap.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's just clap. Ready? [clapping] Yeah! Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what I'm talking about!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I don't know what you're doing here, Michael,

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just having a little 'guys in the workplace' thing.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: ... but it's very destructive.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why can't boys play with dolls? Why does society force us to use urinals when sitting down is far more comfortable?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Can you please do this somewhere else, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We have nowhere else Jan. This...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We could do it in the warehouse.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Dwight, excellent idea. Go to the warehouse.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, OK, Fine. Yeah, actually, perfect. Perfect. You know what? There's another side to this place, gentleman. And I know we all love our cushy jobs and our fun, exciting office. But do you realize that underneath us, there's another world. The warehouse world. A world that is teeming with sweat and dirt and life. Life. The bowels of the office. These guys are down there, they are real men doing real man's work. We are going to learn how a warehouse works.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I think it's going to work out great. Because managing the warehouse is a very important part of my job. And I haven't been there in months.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Remember on Lost when they met the Others?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry about that... um... so where were we? Pam, are you okay taking notes then?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Please? Thank you. very much.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So let's meet the warehouse! Let's get some shots. Pan around there. This is Darryl, one of our warehouse staff. Darryl, what is your biggest fear?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: My biggest fear is that someone will distract us from getting all the shipments out on time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, Darryl is actually the Foreman here and not Roy, which is cool. There's Roy riding the big rig. So Roy is actually going to be marrying Pam sometime this summer. And... uh, she's our receptionist. Sort of a Brangelina thing.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Brangelina is the Brad Pitt and Angelina... Roy...

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I don't understand.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Roy and Pam. It's a Ram. It's a Ram thing.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [talking to Jim] I bet Roy heard about you liking Pam. I bet he'll try to beat you up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks for the head's up, Kev.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I've got your back if he does. But try to stay out of it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [points at math equasion on chalkboard] Uhhuhhuh. Just in case there's someone down here who shouldn't be. A little "Good Will Hunting" situation. All right. Troops. This is an important day. Big day. Now you may look around and see two groups here. White collar. Blue collar. But I don't see it that way. And you know why not? Because I am collar-blind.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Why don't we go around the table and all say something that we know we're good at. I will start. I am good at public speaking.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hi. I'm Meredith and I'm an alch... good at supplier relations.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Great. Phyllis?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm good at computer stuff, emails, spreadsheets, all that.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [disbelieving] Really?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I don't know. I thought that I wasn't going to be asked that...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No. Okay. Stop. Go on...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I've seen some of your spreadsheets.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Really? I thought they were pretty...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know how I fit in with these women. Here. Or with Jan. Um... I mean we get along great. Fine. Um... I guess the person I have the most in common with is...

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Jim... Halpert. Hey uh, I, uh, you know heard there's a rumor going around about you used to have a crush on Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no. No.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: No, it's cool, because I know you're a good guy. And I know that that crush ended a long time ago, so... you know. We're cool, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Nope. Yeah. Definitely.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You know, it's great with me cause that way, glad she has a friend at work she can get through the day with. She's not all bap bap bap bap when she gets home.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. I like talking to her too.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: So, we're cool, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep. Cool, man.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Sweet.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [blows a sigh of relief]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, Mike, look. How bout we go upstairs, too. You know learn how the office works. We can all switch places today.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh... well... okay... yeah, you know what? I don't think... You.. You're... My job sucks compared to this. I don't think you'd like it up there.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: The experience...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guys! Want to start unloading the truck?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. Let's go. Step up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Check this out! Look at that! Look at that [squeezes blow-up doll] bwup-bwa! [talks in girly voice] Hello! How are... [regular voice] Oh! Kay. That is great. That is good stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: In five years, I'd like to be... five years sober.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: That is an excellent goal.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Four and a half.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I'll tell you one thing. I am not going to be one of those women schlepping her kids around in a minivan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Great! Uh-huh?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I want an SUV... with three rows of seats.

Quote.Speaker: Women
Quote.Text: [general murmuring of agreement]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, I'll be honest. One of the goals of these women seminars is to feel out if there's any standouts. Women who could be a valuable addition to our Corporate life.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael wants us to bond so we need topics for conversation.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ponies.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: How about rainbows?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Flowers.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's dangerous, Michael. Come on, get off this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, you're going to, going to hurt yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mike.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stand clear.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mike. Get off of the lift. Please. Come on now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm fine, I'm fine. I'm fine.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Look, would ya... look.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, oh, oh! We'll get somebody to clean that up.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: We're the ones that got to clean that up!

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: Dammit, Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We ought to have this thing serviced.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So! Guy's gripe session. Here we are. Now, we definitely live in different worlds but we have a lot in common. We even like the same girls, some of us. That's going to happen, you know. We're guys, so...

Quote.Speaker: Madge
Quote.Text: Hey, do you want me to go?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, why? Why would I... ? You could...

Quote.Speaker: Madge
Quote.Text: I'll go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stay or...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: ...and a big walk-in closet.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Oh, that's part of my dream too.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, me too.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Great, great. And Pam, what about you? What is your dream?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well... I always dreamed of a house with a terrace upstairs. Plant flowers on it... stuff like that. Since I was a girl. Um... More seriously though, a husband that I love... Roy. And I love to draw. And I... I did a little in college and I'd still love to do something where I could work with art or graphic design in some way.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: She's real good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You know the company is offering a design training program in New York.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well... I have a job right now, so I can't really take time off...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, it's only on weekends and then a few weeks in New York, but I'm sure that I could ask Corporate to help you out.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well... it's just that the weekends aren't good because, um...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: There are always a million reasons not to do something.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's start with the Warehouse. What bothers you as guys, you know?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: My priority is safety.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: So it really bothers me when somebody comes in here speeding around on a lift, playing with it like a toy. It kind of gets under my skin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, Yeah. Yeah. Yeah shhh...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Uh uh uh. Don't shush me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... That was just...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That bothers me too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was breathing.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Pam shushes me. It drives me crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I hate shushing. You know, that's the thing! What the... ok... what is our beef as human men.

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: You know that's a good question, Hasselhoff. What bugs us?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK. Alright. Good. Guys ragging on each other. That's what guys do... and we love it.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: All right. Let's talk about clothing.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm excited about today. [whispers] I love girl talk.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Dress for the job you want, not the job you have. All right. You can use your clothing to send a message about your ambitions by wearing clothes that reflect what you aspire to be.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm not gaining anything from this seminar. I'm a professional woman. The head of accounting. I'm in the healthiest relationship of my life. I just think it's insulting that Jan thinks we need this. And, apparently, judging from her outfit, Jan aspires to be a whore.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I hate it when girls insist on taking them out to new restaurants every weekend night and then they're like "When are we going to go on a date-date?"

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: I hate that too! [general clapping and agreement]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I hate that too.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That sucks so much.

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: It totally sucks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah and then they make you drive them to Church the next morning. Like "Gas ain't free!"

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: Yeah, on our salaries, man, what do they expect? You know to take us out every weekend? You know what I mean? We're not millionaires.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I feel you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No, you don't. You don't feel us. How can you? You know what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not literally.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You say we're the same, but we get compensated very differently.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: We work the same hours as you and you just said we work a lot harder

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, you do. So...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: But we get paid a lot less.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Word.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Like next to no benefits.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. God! What is that?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It blows. It blows, man. Gah...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You know this would not happen if we had a union.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: That's what I'm talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Whoa, whoa. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's what we need.

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: You know you're right.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Man, see... That's what I've been sayin', man. We need to do this finally.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? Is that necessary? Because you already sorta have a union... of guys.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's more than necessary, Mike. We need this. Roy? You still have that card from the Dockworker's Union?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: In my truck.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dockworker's?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Man, hook you up.

Quote.Speaker: Men
Quote.Text: [generalized clapping]

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: Come on, man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. You know what? I think the problem is the chicks.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Union! Union, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The problem is the chicks. And you gotta blame them.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Are you with us Mike?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah-es.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Welcome to the warehouse.

Quote.Speaker: Group chant
Quote.Text: Michael, Michael, Michael, Mi...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Another issue is inequality of pay between men and women. I'm sure that all of you have felt that before...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [knocks] This is important. Ladies, take a breather. Jan, I uh wanna... Can I help you? Um... I wanted to say that the guys downstairs are thinking about forming a union. And they have some good points...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What? A union! What...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't get hysterical.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm not...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Part of my job is knowing how to talk to women.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's... be... rational... here. What are the pros? What are the cons?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: The cons are that everyone will lose their job. Michael. Everyone. Office, Warehouse. What do you think... the... pros... are... here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't talk to me that way please. Just... they're going to want to hear this from you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You got yourself into this Michael, so you get yourself out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But we're bonding down there!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: That's too bad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I mean I just don't want to have to tell them something they're not going to want to hear.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I don't want to...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. Come on Jan. After all we've been through...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael! Michael! Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We have a history...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...between us.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Don't say another word.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I won't

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Get yourself down stairs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm just saying we have something... Ok. Whatever.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You know what... we could get this done a lot quicker if we formed a type of assembly line.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: This here is a run-out-the-clock situation. Just like upstairs.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Sports metaphors are one of the ways women feel left out of the language of the office. Now, I know this might sound silly but a ... many women ask to go over it. So... Fumble means...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Mistake.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Slip.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Right. Par for the course is a golf term. It means right on track. Below par means worse. Wait... that should mean better, that doesn't make sense.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What about second base? Like if Michael said that he got to second base with you? Does that mean you like closed a deal?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I mean that's a baseball term, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I don't know what Michael was talking about. I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [in the background] ...and you went to Chili's and he got to second base with you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [in the background] Kelly, I don't know what Michael's talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [in the background] He told everybody so I just want to know is that a baseball term...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How's it going down there?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's a complete... well, actually it's exactly what you'd expect, so... How are the girls?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good. We watched a video about our changing bodies.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did you really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Almost.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um... but hey? Something kind of cool. There's this internship in graphic design that Jan was telling us about. She made it sound, like, really great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice. Well, what's it all about?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you should do it. That's great!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's really cool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cold front coming into the Warehouse. Uh oh! Better put on your ski boots! Woohoohoowoo. Waaaah! Happy New Year, Darryl! Hey,Darryl. You ever done this?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Are you married?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm divorced.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That must have been hard.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: It was. Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You were probably feeling really depressed and sad and that's why you did that thing with Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I think you should all spend a little more time thinking about your careers and less time on personal stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Mmmm, I think we're all okay with the balance we've struck.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: At least you don't have kids. You have no kids, right? Thank God.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Okay. Let's take five. I think we can all use five.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: How can someone so beautiful be so sad?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Did you take care of the situation?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yuh, yuh, yes! I... I have essentially...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have essentially. Yes. I've taken some...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Excuse me. I've been told there's been some interest in forming a Union and that Michael supported it. Obviously he's not a friend of yours because he didn't tell you the facts. So let me. If there is even a whiff of unionizing in this branch, I can guarantee you the branch will be shut down like that [snaps her fingers]. They unionized in Pittsfield and we all know what happened in Pittsfield. It will cost each of you a fortune in legal fees and union dues and that will be nothing compared to the cost of losing your jobs. So I would think long and hard before sacrificing your savings and your futures just to send a message. If you have any further questions you can direct them to... to Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dreams are just that. They're dreams. They help get you through the day. Like the thing about the terrace. It's nice but... um... I don't know. It was just something I read in this book when I was twelve. The girl in the book has a terrace outside of her bedroom and she planted flowers on it and I just loved that. Just always kind of stuck with me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So you're not doing it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How did you know?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why not?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just like no big reason. Just a bunch of little reasons.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Roy's right. There's no guarantee it's going to lead to anything anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Roy said that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What? You have something you want to say?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You got to take a chance on something sometime, Pam. I mean, do you want to be a receptionist here, always?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, excuse me! I'm fine with my choices!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You are?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's impractical. I'm not going to try to get a house like that. Um... they don't even make houses like that in Scranton. So, I'm never going to... .

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm just going to put this over there.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: This is not a good idea right here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You did uh... okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pizza. Great equalizer. Rich people love pizza. Poor people love pizza. White people love pizza. Black people love pizza. Do black people like pizza?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey. Um... look guys, I'm sorry. Sometimes Jan can be such a bitch.

Quote.Speaker: All the Men
Quote.Text: Generalized mumbling agreement. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, watch it, watch it. We have a relationship.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you to our hosts.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey Michael. This ain't over.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahhh! Excellent.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is it good to be back. Yeah. I mean I love the guy stuff but to run an office you need men and women. You know why? Because you need to have that crazy sexual tension to keep things interesting.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin. This is Pam. Uh... hold, please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! I don't know, Pam. I paid $400 for this phone because I liked the ring.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You did?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And now, I realize that you can program or download any ring you want. So, I'm a little overwhelmed.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There's a lot of choices. You got to help me here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Which one of these is coolest? What do you think? [classical piano playing] [violin playing]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How about that one?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. [blues piano playing]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, that one was good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dude, are you kidding me? No. That one says, "I am so lame." Know which one I want? There's one that sounds like a jackhammer. Just really grabs your attention. It's like... [imitating jackhammer] You know what I'm talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do you mean vibrate?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Bushmaster's hard to beat for long distance. It's a great point.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. I got a spudgun in my car.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. Shoot a chuck of potato at your face, 80 PSI, bon appetit!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you guys talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight and Roy
Quote.Text: [at the same time] Guns.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: How's that union stuff coming?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Working on it.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Guys! Check it out! Spudgun! Woohoo! Bon appetit! [Darryl's office window shatters] Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's my office.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There was this film that I saw when I was little. It was about a kid who goes on the most incredible adventure. And even though it was really great, and she had a great time, she ends up back home in Kansas and says, "There's no place like home." And that's how I feel right now. There is no place like home. What the hell was that movie called? [sighs] It's gonna drive me crazy.
